title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 15 November 2011 - XWiki
content:
00:14 <CIA-102> Denis Gervalle feature-immutable-refs \* rcea4249 / (10 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7097 Make EntityReference immutables, adding parameters to EntityReference and allowing Locale and Version in DocumentReference ...  
00:28 <CIA-102> Denis Gervalle feature-immutable-refs \* r1b8d111 / (32 files in 4 dirs): xwiki-platform-model: remove checkstyle exclusions and ensure checkstyle compliance - http://git.io/OJCaXA  
00:39 <CIA-102> Denis Gervalle feature-immutable-refs \* r388e7c6 / (202 files in 97 dirs): Merge branch 'master' into feature-immutable-refs - http://git.io/JWvitw

07:47 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:02 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <CIA-102> tmortagne master \* r4ad16c1 / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-pageobjects/pom.xml : Missing dependency - http://git.io/wpJ8uQ  
09:24 <Denis1> vmassol: I am not sure to understand your comment  
09:25 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
09:26 <+Denis> vmassol: you wanted helpers like setLocale initially, but you will never have it, do you really want to expose the key and construct a Map each time you want to create a DocumentReference ?  
09:48 <CIA-102> Denis Gervalle feature-immutable-refs \* r959c9b1 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-model/src/main/java/org/xwiki/model/internal/reference/StringReferenceSeparators.java : [misc] improve codestyle - http://git.io/hdcpWw  
09:54 <CIA-102> Denis Gervalle feature-immutable-refs \* r46e5551 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-model/src/main/java/org/xwiki/model/internal/reference/StringReferenceSeparators.java : [misc] Really improve codestyle (fix previous commit, sorry) - http://git.io/UW-QXg  
09:56 <CIA-102> tmortagne master \* r483947e / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-repositories/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki-server-ui/src/main/resources/ExtensionCode/ExtensionAuthorsDisplayer.xml : XWIKI-7114: Improve XWiki Repository UI ...  
09:59 <tmortagne> has left #xwiki  
10:00 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <vmassol> Denis: my comment is about the constructor. The references are immutable so I guess setParameter() isn't going to work right?  
10:17 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r56b50ef / (2 files): XWIKI-7147: Extract the Dashboard feature into a Dashboard Application and module ...  
10:42 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r622c32b / (4 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7147: Extract the Dashboard feature into a Dashboard Application and module ...  
10:46 <vmassol> guys why is agent 6 called "http://ci.xwiki.org/computer/agent-6%20(immutable-refs)/" ?  
10:55 <+Denis> vmassol: because I temporarily use it to test a full build of XE with immutable-refs  
10:57 <+Denis> vmassol: setParameters will not work right, but if you have to build a Map of parameters each time you have to set them, it will be heavy and boring, no ?  
10:57 <vmassol> Denis: are the refs immutable or not?  
10:57 <+Denis> they are  
10:58 <vmassol> (I didn't check yet your full commit)  
10:58 <vmassol> then there's not setXXX right?  
10:58 <vmassol> s/not/no/  
10:58 <+Denis> no public one yes  
10:58 <vmassol> so there's no other solution than passing params in the constructor, correct?  
10:58 <+Denis> correct  
10:59 <+Denis> but you seems unhappy passing specific parameters  
10:59 <vmassol> ok so we're inline, my comment is only that we don't have a constructor for that  
10:59 <+Denis> I thought we do not want it  
10:59 <vmassol> you seem to be assuming that we'll only have 1 param ever  
10:59 <+Denis> no, why ?  
10:59 <vmassol> but I thought the commit was about supporting any # of params  
10:59 <vmassol> how do you set them if there's no constructor?  
11:00 <vmassol> (did I miss it?)-  
11:00 <+Denis> I assure you will have a limited set of specific params with the appropriate constructor overload for now  
11:01 <vmassol> then we're going to break the api again later which isn't good  
11:01 <vmassol> we need to support N params  
11:01 <vmassol> IMO  
11:01 <vmassol> also I didn't see any support for Version is that voluntary?  
11:01 <vmassol> (I didn't check much, just looked at the constructor so maybe I missied something)  
11:01 <+tmortagne> btw I forgot, who want's to be build manager this week ?  
11:02 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:03 <+Denis> vmassol: not yet implemented, some doubt on the type to use  
11:03 <+Denis> and not required for my doc id migration issue  
11:04 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle ?  
11:04 <+tmortagne> Denis ?  
11:09 <+Denis> tmortagne: I 'll take it then  
11:09 <vmassol> guys we need to start thinking about releasing 3.3M2 :)  
11:09 <vmassol> it was supposed to be yesterday  
11:10 <vmassol> I'm almost done on my side with the dashboard module move, just need 1-2 more hours to finish validating that the full build passes  
11:10 <@sdumitriu> I'll start it after I wake up  
11:10 <vmassol> hey sergiu is messaging while sleeping :)  
11:10 <vmassol> maybe he has a bot?  
11:10 <vmassol> :)  
11:10 <@sdumitriu> Nope  
11:11 <vmassol> mflorea: what's your status for the release?  
11:11 <vmassol> Denis: are you done too?  
11:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: anything more on your side for 3.3M2?  
11:11 <vmassol> sdumitriu: nothing for the EM UI to commit? :(  
11:12 <+tmortagne> vmassol: nothing blocker  
11:12 <vmassol> would be great if eveyrone could update http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap  
11:13 <+Denis> vmassol: I am checkin today a full build for immutable-refs on agent-6, then I will be able to commit that  
11:13 <vmassol> you didn't commit?  
11:13 <vmassol> your commit was on a branch?  
11:13 <+Denis> vmassol: not on master yes  
11:13 <vmassol> oh  
11:13 <vmassol> ok, I thoguht it was on master  
11:13 <vmassol> hmmmm  
11:13 <vmassol> it's a bit later  
11:14 <vmassol> \*late  
11:14 <vmassol> 3.3M2 was supposed to be yesterday  
11:14 <+Denis> I have waited long for a review  
11:14 <vmassol> that doesn't change anything  
11:14 <vmassol> this means postponing the release by 1-2 more days right?  
11:15 <vmassol> since we need to be sure of the overall quality  
11:15 <vmassol> let's see what the others say and need for their own tasks  
11:15 <vmassol> I'm concerned about the EM UI  
11:15 <+mflorea> vmassol: I need 2-3 hours to finish  
11:15 <+Denis> yes, but I would really like to have also docid migration  
11:16 <+Denis> I am not sure this would be nice for a RC1  
11:16 <vmassol> sburjan: I think you wanted to update http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap with the new jira macro?  
11:17 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
11:17 <vmassol> guys make sure you update http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap with the currnet status  
11:17 <+sburjan> vmassol: yes, I could update it. May I start ?  
11:17 <vmassol> sburjan: sure  
11:18 <+sburjan> and we'll polish the columns we need after I finish  
11:18 <+sburjan> ok, give me 10 minutes  
11:20 <vmassol> sdumitriu: when you're awaken, please let us know about the status for the EM UI  
11:21 <Enygma`> has quit  
11:32 <vmassol> mflorea: in case you don't know there are some failing wysiwyg tests on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/  
11:33 <vmassol> mflorea: wow never seen this either: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/1003/console  
11:33 <vmassol> fluke?  
11:36 <+mflorea> wdym? the jvm crached, it happens often..  
11:37 <vmassol> I don't see a crash  
11:37 <vmassol> ah yes  
11:38 <vmassol> was looking at the bottom  
11:38 <vmassol> yes we seem to have ltos of crashes  
11:38 <vmassol> I looked other failing builds and some are also caused by a crashed JVM  
11:38 <vmassol> we should investigate since it's starting to be a lot of false positives  
11:39 <vmassol> is there a newer version of the JVM on linux: JRE version: 6.0\_26-b03  
11:39 <vmassol> ?  
11:39 <+mflorea> the exception at the end is because the GWT compiling is done in a separate process and the main process  fails to communicate with the failing one  
11:39 <vmassol> mflorea: ok I see  
11:40 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I think 1.6.0\_26-b03 is the last one  
11:40 <vmassol> ok too bad then...  
11:41 <+tmortagne> there is a 29 officially  
11:41 <vmassol> going for an early lunch… bbiab  
11:41 <+tmortagne> but 26 is the last one on repositories  
11:41 <+tmortagne> but I think we don't use the one from reporisories  
11:41 <+tmortagne> so we would try  
11:41 <+mflorea> re WYSIWYG functional tests, I believe they fails because of http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7147 . Did we remove/renamed Main.Dashboard ? (it seems it isn't present in the XWiki Explorer tree http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/489/testReport/org.xwiki.test.wysiwyg/LinkTest/testCreateAndEditLinkOnImage/ )  
11:42 <+tmortagne> could try Java 7 maybe  
11:42 <+tmortagne> forget that  
11:42 <+tmortagne> we need to build with the supported version  
11:43 <+tmortagne> but we can try upgrading to update 29  
11:43 <+tmortagne> looking at it  
11:43 <+tmortagne> mflorea: it has been moved, maybe vmassol forgot to put the new app as XE dependency  
11:44 <+mflorea> I think the test needs to be updated because Main.Dashboard has been moved inside the Dashboard space  
11:44 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:44 <+tmortagne> wasn't Main.Dashboard supposed to include the new one ?  
11:45 <+tmortagne> don't remember  
11:45 <+tmortagne> maybe not  
11:50 <+tmortagne> agent-1 now runs on 1.6.0\_29 (used to be 25)  
11:50 <+tmortagne> moving others  
11:57 <CIA-102> Denis Gervalle feature-immutable-refs \* r3c8e5d6 / (4 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7097 Make EntityReference immutables, adding parameters to EntityReference and allowing Locale and Version in DocumentReference ...  
12:01 <+tmortagne> all agent on last java version except agent-3  
12:01 <+tmortagne> back in 1h  
12:01 <+tmortagne> 2h  
12:05 <CIA-102> Denis Gervalle feature-immutable-refs \* r7d49ddb / xwiki-platform-core/pom.xml : XWIKI-7097 Make EntityReference immutables, adding parameters to EntityReference and allowing Locale and Version in DocumentReference ...  
12:06 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r231181e / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-dashboard/xwiki-platform-dashboard-ui/src/main/resources/Dashboard/WebHome.xml : XWIKI-7147: Extract the Dashboard feature into a Dashboard Application and module ...  
12:06 <+sburjan> vmassol: backend stuff ported  
12:06 <vmassol> sburjan: can you do the frontend too?  
12:07 <+sburjan> yes  
12:07 <vmassol> cool  
12:09 <vmassol> tmortagne: is it "normal" that l10n takes so long to display http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/XWikiCoreResources?language=fr ?  
12:09 <vmassol> (took at least 30seconds)  
12:29 <vmassol> tmortagne: why is this page empty: http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Platform/WebHome ?  
12:29 <vmassol> I was expecting to see the ApplicationResources.properties there  
12:29 <vmassol> there's also a broken link in a left panel on that pagehttp://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Platform/WebHome  
12:30 <vmassol> (in the quick links panel)  
12:51 <+sburjan> vmassol: done  
12:52 <+sburjan> a lot of improvements to JIRA Macro. I will make them in the close future  
12:52 <vmassol> sburjan: cool, can you add a "Notes" column too?  
12:53 <vmassol> actually there's one small issue :) Once our version is released, the status will no longer reflect what was done at that point in time ;)  
12:55 <vmassol> hmmm other issue is that it's misleading  
12:55 <vmassol> for example XE-893 appears closed  
12:55 <vmassol> but it's not!  
12:56 <vmassol> it's just marked as a duplicate of XE-844 which is open....  
12:56 <+sburjan> just a sec, I think we have some mistakes on the page  
12:56 <vmassol> this one looks wrong indeed: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-1015  
12:56 <vmassol> it's old  
12:56 <vmassol> very old  
12:57 <+sburjan> ok, I'm going to rollback  
12:57 <vmassol> why?  
12:58 <vmassol> why did you rollback?  
12:58 <vmassol> you could have simply looked at the past rev to compare  
12:58 <+sburjan> now we can see the issues from the origianl and compare wit h the ones found by the macro  
12:59 <vmassol> rollbacking it just created an unecessary revision  
12:59 <vmassol> polluting the history for no reason  
12:59 <vmassol> and moreover there's a comparison feature  
13:00 <vmassol> http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap?viewer=changes&rev1=74.3&rev2=74.7  
13:01 <vmassol> you made 2 mistakes  
13:02 <vmassol> XWIKI-6018 and XWIKI-6227  
13:02 <vmassol> instead of XE-795 and XASEARCH-12  
13:02 <+sburjan> vmassol: It's hard for me to explain. those issues wew moved, and if you search on JIRA for XASEARCH-12 you wil lbe redirected  
13:03 <+sburjan> vmassol: It's hard for me to explain. those issues wew moved, and if you search on JIRA for XASEARCH-12 you will be redirected  
13:03 <vmassol> indeed the irc bot think so too :)  
13:03 <+sburjan> also, if you specify a broken key to the MAcro, the macro break  
13:03 <vmassol> so no problem  
13:04 <+sburjan> no, thant one is ok  
13:04 <+sburjan> the only issue is XWIKI-1015. I think that was a mistake when we created the page, a typo  
13:04 <+sburjan> I'm sure the keyId is not 1015  
13:04 <vmassol> yep  
13:04 <vmassol> must be a mistake  
13:04 <+sburjan> let's search by description and get the correct ID :)  
13:05 <+sburjan> XW-1015  
13:05 <+sburjan> XE-1015  
13:05 <+sburjan> so it's XE, not XWIKI  
13:06 <vmassol> ok  
13:07 <vmassol> ok so we still have the 2 issues I mentioned  
13:07 <vmassol> FTM could you add the notes column?  
13:07 <+sburjan> yes, what do you want me to add to notes ?  
13:08 <vmassol> 'll replace XE\_893 by the duplicated issue  
13:08 <vmassol> empty for now  
13:08 <+sburjan> ok  
13:08 <vmassol> but a notes column  
13:09 <mflorea> has quit  
13:10 <+sburjan> notes column added  
13:10 <+sburjan> vmassol:  so XASEARCH-12 redirects to XWIKI-6227  
13:11 <+sburjan> so I replaced it with the new one  
13:12 <vmassol> ok  
13:13 <+sburjan> so it's everything ok FTM ?  
13:13 <vmassol> yes thanks  
13:13 <vmassol> there's the issue about when we release  
13:13 <+sburjan> no problem. glad now we removed the human errors from the Roadmap page :)  
13:13 <vmassol> I don't know how to handle this or we just say we don't care  
13:13 <vmassol> btw I think we should also transform the main roadmap items into jira issues as part of our roadmap process  
13:14 <vmassol> I'll discuss this on the list later on  
13:14 <vmassol> sdumitriu, Denis, cjdelisle, tmortagne: can you please update http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap with your current status for tasks assigned to you?  
13:14 <vmassol> I think tmortagne has updated it  
13:15 <vmassol> would be good to put the jira issues in the summary maybe?  
13:16 <+sburjan> where is the summary ?  
13:16 <vmassol> the "task" column  
13:17 <+sburjan> well they are already in the JIRA Issue column (right next to "task" column)  
13:17 <vmassol> sdumitriu: is it normal that there's no blog post for 3.3M1 on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/News ?  
13:49 <CIA-102> Denis Gervalle feature-immutable-refs \* re13b2ed / xwiki-platform-core/pom.xml : XWIKI-7097 Make EntityReference immutables, adding parameters to EntityReference and allowing Locale and Version in DocumentReference ...  
14:03 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:06 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r2e945bf / (2 files): XWIKI-7147: Extract the Dashboard feature into a Dashboard Application and module ...  
14:37 <+tmortagne> vmassol: http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Platform/WebHome is empty because I never had time to move ApplicationResource there, it's not a trivial task  
14:37 <vmassol> so shouldn't we remove it from the panel on the left?  
14:37 <vmassol> because right now it's confusing  
14:38 <+tmortagne> and yes I already updated http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap  
14:39 <+tmortagne> the panel is not hardcoded the list is generated, I will see what I can do  
14:39 <vmassol> tmortagne: just a confirmation: when I enter some translations on l10n I don't need to escape single quotes and accents right?  
14:40 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yes, nothing to do, it will take care of that when exporting  
14:40 <vmassol> l10n is really slow… I reloaded the core resources about 10mn ago, I don't know if it's still working  
14:40 <vmassol> I've been trying to save some translations for 3 minutes now still saving...  
14:40 <+tmortagne> plus the escaping is only done for ApplictaionResources and not wiki pages since it's useless in wiki pages  
14:41 <+tmortagne> vmassol: reloading ApplicationResource is very long since it has to upadte all languages and there is a lot now  
14:41 <vmassol> more thna 10 minutes?  
14:41 <vmassol> (that's already really long)  
14:41 <+tmortagne> don't know never conoted but given the number of translations and language it would not suprise me  
14:42 <+tmortagne> counted  
14:42 <vmassol> ok I hope I haven't lost my transaltions  
14:42 <vmassol> my page has expired (skol)  
14:42 <+tmortagne> timeout is never an issue, you thread is still running on server  
14:42 <+tmortagne> why did you releaded them ?  
14:42 <vmassol> because I introduced new keys  
14:43 <vmassol> and they were not showing up  
14:43 <+tmortagne> when did you introduced them ? today ?  
14:43 <vmassol> yes  
14:43 <vmassol> it's only reloade every night AFAIR  
14:43 <+tmortagne> ok so it's normal  
14:43 <+tmortagne> yes because it's slow mostly  
14:44 <vmassol> hmm taking really long  
14:44 <vmassol> when I go to http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/XWikiCoreResources?action=viewempty&language=fr I still see the translations I've translated  
14:45 <CIA-102> Denis Gervalle feature-immutable-refs \* r09eb256 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-wysiwyg/xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-server/src/main/java/org/xwiki/wysiwyg/server/internal/DefaultWysiwygEditorConfiguration.java : XWIKI-7097 Make EntityReference immutables, adding parameters to EntityReference and allowing Locale and Version in DocumentReference ...  
14:45 <vmassol> the wiki seems quick again now  
14:45 <vmassol> so it doesn't seem normal  
14:45 <vmassol> that my translations have not been saved already  
14:45 <+tmortagne> vmassol: which keys is that ?  
14:45 <vmassol> they seem lost  
14:45 <vmassol> all platform.dashboard.\*  
14:45 <+tmortagne> I don't see how, getting a timeout from the browser should not have any impact on the server  
14:46 <vmassol> unless you have a cache on that page but I doubt it  
14:46 <vmassol> all I can see is the result  
14:46 <vmassol> and the result is that my translations are not there  
14:46 <vmassol> and I doubt they'll ever come  
14:46 <vmassol> I'll go back in the browser and see if I still have them  
14:47 <vmassol> yep I have same  
14:47 <+tmortagne> no there is cache only for the calculations  
14:47 <vmassol> saving again  
14:47 <vmassol> still slow  
14:48 <vmassol> whenever I try this wiki it's slow  
14:48 <vmassol> we have some perf issues  
14:48 <vmassol> somewhere  
14:48 <vmassol> I'm trying to save 12 translations  
14:50 <vmassol> this wiki is unusable as is, we should provide a page containing all translations for a page and be done with it :)  
14:51 <vmassol> still trying to save….  
14:52 <vmassol> timeout again  
14:53 <vmassol> :(  
14:55 <vmassol> Denis: I don't undertand why you've tied your branch to an agent?  
14:55 <+Denis> because I am polluting its maven repository  
14:55 <vmassol> not nice: https://skitch.com/e-vmassol/geakh/menubar  
14:56 <vmassol> Denis: why polluting?  
14:56 <vmassol> local repo are made for that  
14:56 <+Denis> install plateform, so I will be able to build XE  
14:56 <vmassol> I don't understand  
14:56 <vmassol> ok l10n seems dead  
14:57 <vmassol> I get skol now  
14:57 <+Denis> I do not have hardware ressource locally to properly test the full build of XE, sorry for that, and I do not want to risk a commit that break the build right now  
14:58 <vmassol> Denis: my question is not why you're using jenkins

20:03 <@cjdelisle> Denis: I wanted to talk about your proposal a bit, I'm with you on most of it, the only thing I don't like is the version information in the reference.  
20:03 <@cjdelisle> There are a few problems with that:  
20:05 <@cjdelisle> #1 is when you save a document, the storage needs to remove the version information from the reference before serializing it (presumably into a UUID), this makes the version tag kind of magic since it's handled specially.  
20:06 <@cjdelisle> #2 is that the ui is weird, a user can say getDocument(referenceTo3rdVersionOfMainWebHome)  
20:06 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
20:06 <@cjdelisle> so he will assume that he can say search("where name = 'Main.WebHome' and version = 3")  
20:06 <@cjdelisle> and that won't work because storage doesn't work that way  
20:06 <+Denis> for #1 we plan to have a resolver that may filter params from references  
20:07 <@cjdelisle> but with version information in the reference, we fool the user into thinking it does and he will be unhappy when the world is not as he thought.  
20:08 <+Denis> #2 a nice improvement, by the way, my goal is to get Locale for now, Version is a proposal from Vincent that have came with it, and I do not intend to implement it for now  
20:08 <@cjdelisle> awesome, I don't like version, local is pretty important since local plays a very specific and unique role in XWiki.  
20:09 <@cjdelisle> \*locale  
20:09 <+Denis> but the question is mainly how we expect to use params in reference  
20:10 <+Denis> my point being that it could not be done freely and that it should be more easy than building a Map  
20:10 <@cjdelisle> As far as extending it with additional perameters, I agree with you whole heartedly and for a number of reasons which I am writing in a message now.  
20:11 <@cjdelisle> I don't think there should be additional parameters because they allow users to do things which they shouldn't and it creates confusing situations which only become apparent down the road.  
20:11 <+Denis> For my current needs, I have only a requirement on Locale, so this is not "urgent" to fix the Version issue, but it is important to see how the future could be when more params are added (Version being a possibility, but not the only one)  
20:11 <@cjdelisle> Basicly it becomes an arbitrarily high dimentional tree structure which is never used for anything like document storage.  
20:12 <@cjdelisle> People are not able to think in terms of k-d trees for documents and they really shouldn't.  
20:12 <+Denis> hum  
20:12 <+Denis> params are not in the tree, compare to wiki, space, and document  
20:13 <+Denis> params are qualifiers on any of them  
20:14 <@cjdelisle> If you have <wiki>.<space>.<space>.<name> and you add a parameter, you can split that out in another dimention so documents don't collide  
20:14 <+Denis> yes, you are right  
20:14 <@cjdelisle> each parameter you add adds another dimention to your tree structure and that is not used in filesystems nor urls so people have no experience with it.  
20:14 <+Denis> and there is also the ability to remove them at any point  
20:15 <@cjdelisle> The problem is we are creating a tempting danger for users.  
20:15 <@cjdelisle> They might think they need a perameter but a k-d tree is absolutely what they don't need.  
20:16 <@cjdelisle> Also databases are not able to do searches on that kind of information. With normal sql you would end up doing horrific like 'something%somethingElse%' type searches which would take forever.  
20:17 <+Denis> but we I only expect to allow finite and well defined parameters  
20:17 <+Denis> and this at the "typed" reference level  
20:18 <+Denis> only the entity reference expose "generic" parameters  
20:18 <+Denis> and this is only for the sake of the implementation, these are protected methods  
20:20 <+Denis> you can look at the feature-immutable-refs branch for details on my implementation  
20:20 <vmassol> sorry guys got to go get my son, caleb remember that a URL or URI is a reference and it allows parameters…. we need somehow to be able to carry the same kind of information  
20:20 <@cjdelisle> URL parameters are different, they are arguments which are passed to the page when it is "executed" they are not descriminators for which page to load.  
20:21 <vmassol> URI are references and are meaningful  
20:21 <vmassol> the params are optional but needed to qualify the reference  
20:21 <vmassol> like the anchor, version, locale, etc  
20:21 <vmassol> got to go sorry :)  
20:21 <@cjdelisle> ok, we can continue on the list.  
20:23 <vmassol> btw guys, my comments were about Denis implementation  
20:23 <vmassol> not about the proposal  
20:23 <vmassol> the proposal was already discused adn vote  
20:23 <vmassol> voted  
20:23 <vmassol> from I see you don't agree about the initial proplsal  
20:23 <vmassol> so you should resend a vote for it then  
20:23 <vmassol> I assumed everyone agreed since it was voted  
20:24 <+Denis> only dumbs do not change their minds :)  
20:25 <@cjdelisle> Well it has not been implemented so as I see it, there is plenty of time for us to continue discussion.  
20:26 <@cjdelisle> That thinking would make more sense if a lot of work had been put in to the implentation of that design but according to Denis, the version part has not been done, nor has the arbitrary parameters

21:22 <@cjdelisle> [xwiki-users] How to display only activities in activity stream from spaces that user has access to

21:24 <@cjdelisle> I don't know, it sounds like your email provider and the list software are not getting along for some reason.

21:27 <@cjdelisle> I see  
21:28 <@cjdelisle> What I think is happening now is that someone who's email address is @gedi.pt is bouncing messages but instead of bouncing them to the list, it is bouncing them directly back to you.  
21:30 <@cjdelisle> yup, gmail adds a reply-to header to the message, someone who is subscribed to the list is now bouncing messages, they were probably bounced to you and the list.  
21:31 <nimbvs> yeah. you're right. I had Reply-to configured in my email client  
21:31 <@cjdelisle> You can safely ignore those bounces, after 3 bounces the list will kick them off.  
21:31 <nimbvs> mistery solved  
21:31 <nimbvs> thanks  
21:32 <@cjdelisle> I will send mail to the infra team and ask if they are able to strip reply-to headers since it's annoying to be trying to send a reply to the list and accidently make a discussion private.
